recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally recognized Indian tribe governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to authority vested in the Council by a Constitution approved in November 1937, as amended;

The Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council has the authority under its Constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to act on behalf of the Community in area of economic affairs and other issues of self-governance;
For the convenience of community members and governmental operations, the Tribe has taken the approach of having its ordinances publicly available on the Internet;

The Tribe is working with Open Law Library (“OLL”) to codify the Tribe’s ordinances and publish them in a new electronic tribal law library. It is OLL’s mission to make all official law freely and openly accessible to the public in human and computer readable formats and OLL develops and maintains software systems in the public domain for the performance of this mission;
OLL’s software is capable of ensuring that the published code is:

ul.li: 1. Preservable: All published laws will be maintained meet or exceed all requirements for level 2 preservation as specified by the National Digital Stewardship Alliance,
2. Authenticatable: All published laws will be authenticatable as the official laws of the Tribe. Authentication will use Open Law Library certificates, and
3. Accessible: All published laws will be available to the public through OLL or the Tribe will have ability to self-host the published laws.

recital.text: The Tribe, as part of establishing its new online Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Law Library, intends to codify its ordinances as the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code. This codification includes reorganizing and renumbering the ordinances into titles grouping similar subject areas; and
The Tribe also wishes to make the online Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code the official version of the Tribe’s ordinances.
the Tribal Council codifies its current ordinances as the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code.

this codification of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code includes reorganizing the existing tribal ordinances into titles that group ordinances with similar subject areas. Tribal ordinances shall be reorganized, and renumbered appropriately, into the following Titles.

ul.li: Custody, Physical Placement and Visitation Ordinance
Domestic Abuse Restraining Order and Injunction Ordinance

li.text: Title PRP – Property and Land Management
Title SAF – Safety and Public Health

ul.li: Public Peace and Good Order Ordinance
Communicable Disease, Vaccination, and Quarantine Ordinance

li.text: Title UTL – Utilities and Public Improvements
Title VEH – Vehicles, Roads and Traffic

recital.text: as part of this codification, the Tribal Council authorizes administrative corrections to replace inaccurate citations and references within the individual ordinances, update renumbering within and between ordinances, correct typos, and make other similar minor changes that do not change the substantive content of the ordinances that are part of the Tribal Code.

the electronic version of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code, which is published online using OLL software and which is part of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Law Library, shall be the official version of such code. Additionally, this Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code shall be in the public domain.
the electronic Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Code shall be effective as of March 1, 2021.
